subtitles_text: JEFF PROBST: Previously on Survivor...

repulsive.

and hearts and gizzards.  In Taiwan,
it's considered a great,you know, snack.
Yech!

One of the things we...we've got to kind of do is
have each other's back.
He's confirmed that, yes, he is totally committed
to me all the way to the end.
-It's done.-It's done.

we lost the boat?! (groans)

-Chuay Gahn wins immunity!-(cheering)

and although Shii Ann received two votes,
Stephanie was voted  out of the tribe.

11 are left.
Who will be the next to go?

Trust is something that does shift, especially as
you do get further in the game, because
we're all herefor a million dollars.

'Cause I don't want to...I don't want to base my opinions
of people about how they playthis, and I know I'm going to.

And I said, "Absolutely not,100% never was I going
to write yourname down last night."
And he said, "Well, you know, that's kind of funny because

I don't know how much truthis being said, you know.
There's no reason to lie to me.
I don't likebackstabbing bull ...

thinking that maybe Ken
is playing two different sides.

and Penny is telling meone thing.

and I told you I've beenstraight up with you,
so obviously... I don't know.

you're playing a harder gamethan anyone here.

who did everybody else tell youto vote for?

from the other tribe.Your job--
using wicker baskets,catch the balls being launched
by your ball launcher.
Every time you catch one,you score a point.
At the same time,you're trying to stop
the other tribefrom catching their ball.
Each tribe may callone timeout.
During a timeout,you can strategize.
You can also swap positions.
First tribe to catch fivewicker balls wins reward.
